posts.post_content:
This card IS, in fact, power creeped.  
It has abilities that outclass virtually every other 6-drop, and it has a 6/6 body for six mana on an artifact.  
That's way better than black, blue, red, and sometimes white get without some sort of drawbacks. Instead of drawbacks, it has two incredible keywords, and an extremely powerful ability.  
It's ridiculous, and it puts pretty much every other 6-drop to shame

posts.post_content:
Why is this a hundred times better than [Pelakka Wurm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pelakka Wurm)? Pelakka is heavy green and at seven, he has the right to be overpowered (and is really not)... At six colorless, Wurmcoil Engine has no right to be absurd.
  
   
This would've been fair as a 4/4 that makes 2/2's, and it still would have seen play.

posts.post_content:
@Majinara: You say "Mythich means in this case simply 'over the power curve', which is imho not the way rarities should be handled." That's actually one of the ways rarity is and *should* be handled. If it's really powerful, it needs to be higher in rarity so it shows up less in Limited games because it's pulled less frequently in boosters.  
  
None of this is meant to justify the card itself. I agree that it should not have been printed as is. It seems way more like a Green/Black card than a colorless one. The main negative of it being an artifact - dies to [Naturalize](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Naturalize) - is removed with the addition of the token ability. In most *colored* creature cards you'd be lucky to see this with 6/6 at 7 CMC, let alone 6.
posts.html:
@Majinara: You say "Mythich means in this case simply 'over the power curve', which is imho not the way rarities should be handled." That's actually one of the ways rarity is and should be handled. If it's really powerful, it needs to be higher in rarity so it shows up less in Limited games because it's pulled less frequently in boosters.

None of this is meant to justify the card itself. I agree that it should not have been printed as is. It seems way more like a Green/Black card than a colorless one. The main negative of it being an artifact - dies to Naturalize - is removed with the addition of the token ability. In most colored creature cards you'd be lucky to see this with 6/6 at 7 CMC, let alone 6.

posts.post_content:
"Hey guys, I have a great idea! Remember [Penumbra Wurm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Penumbra Wurm)? Yeah, it's that cool green creature from way back in the Invasion block! I was thinking we should print something like it again, but this time why don't we reduce its casting cost by ![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol) and eliminate its color requirements so that it's playable in any deck, and then give it Deathtouch and Lifelink so that it's never reduced to a mere chump-blocker on the defense or made totally useless by chump-blockers on the offense? I'm sure that removing Trample, splitting the token into two smaller creatures, and making it vulnerable to artifact-destruction will balance it enough."  
  
Hmm.  
  
In any case, awesome art.
posts.html:

I'm sure that removing Trample, splitting the token into two smaller creatures, and making it vulnerable to artifact-destruction will balance it enough."

posts.post_content: I will say, this guy's pretty much a boss. He deserves 5/5, I agree, but just for everyone's info, there are ways around him. The simplest being (and it has to be the reason they made it) [Revoke Existence](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Revoke Existence), another way is to kill the main ([Doom Blade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doom Blade),  [Beast Within](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name= Beast Within), etc.) and then use Steel Hellkite with his ability at zero to blow up the tokens. Use one colorless artifact creature to kill another.
